Bug.Summery: [Preferences] Search only uses page names
Bug.WithStack: I20041214-2000 Select Window > Preferences. Type in the word "tab" in the search/filter box. Nothing matches. However there are plenty of pages that refer to preferences having to do with tabs. Filtering on the name of the page and not the preferences themselves doesn't seem terribly useful. For plug-in activation reasons we do not want to go creating every page in order to read its labels. However we are looking into adding more context either by keywords or descriptions. Keyword support has been added for build >20050127 Verified in 20050215-2300

Bug.Summery: ToolItem allocates space for non-existent icon
Bug.WithStack: A ToolItem should just display the text if there's no image. Currently it seems to allocate space for the missing icon. See attached image. Created attachment 16668 Screenshot showing the problem I think this is native behavior probably done for consistent vertical alignment of text. The workbench should change the text placement to be SWT.RIGHT, so that the text appears beside the icon instead of below it. Sorry but this is Windows platform behavior. We CANTFIX. Steve, shouldn't the workbench be using either SWT.LEFT or SWT.RIGHT, so that clients putting stuff on the toolbar can set the text without changing the toolbar height? They could see if this makes things better. There was a bug on Windows once where space was left to the left (or was it right) of the text when there was no image but I believe that it has been fixed. You could get them to try it.

Created attachment 16668 Screenshot showing the problem I think this is native behavior probably done for consistent vertical alignment of text. The workbench should change the text placement to be SWT.RIGHT, so that the text appears beside the icon instead of below it. Sorry but this is Windows platform behavior. We CANTFIX. They could see if this makes things better. Bug.Summery: [Progress] The error is not selected in Error Running Operation dialog
Bug.WithStack:
We have this problem in R3_0. When the “Error running operation” dialog pops up the user has to explicitly click on the first error to see details about it. This shouldn’t be necessary. Especially novice users don’t know that to get more information they are required to click on the error. If we automatically select the first error that will save the user some time and wondering. In most cases the dialog show only one error so selecting the first error is better than no selection. In the case of multiple errors in the dialog, selection the first one still makes sense since it give a cue the user than browsing the errors will show more info. Created attachment 16675 select the first item in the list
This is a patch for R3_0. This was rewitten in 3.1. See Bug 76726
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 76726 ***

Bug.Summery: Possible deadlock initializing jdt.core
Bug.WithStack:
From bug 81303, the following stack trace was found starting a workspace.
I was checking a project out of eclipse.org as anonymous@pserver when eclipse crashed. Here is all I could find:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2004-12-15 14:50:46.428 !MESSAGE While loading class "org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore$7", thread "Worker-4" timed out waiting (5000ms) for thread "Worker-2" to finish starting bundle "org.eclipse.jdt.core". To avoid deadlock, thread "Worker-4" is proceeding but "org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore$7" may not be fully initialized. !STACK 0 java.lang.Exception: Generated exception. at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.findLocalClass(EclipseClassLoader.java: 102) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findLocalClass(BundleLoader.java:371) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:402) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.AbstractClassLoader.loadClass(AbstractClassLoader.java:93) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302) at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore$6.run(JavaCore.java:4125) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
This shows that a deadlock appended starting jdt.core. Can someone explain how this show a deadlock ? Where is the second thread ? This stack trace is pretty useless as it is. The problem here is not a deadlock but actually a concurrency problem while JDT core is starting.
The message indicates that while "Worker-2" thread was activating the jdt core plugin, the thread "worker-4" has been trying to load a class (from jdt core) and that the loading of this class has been delayed until the startup of jdt core startup is over (or a 5s delay has expired).
Thanks Pascal, but I don't see how we can identify the problem without knowing which classes were being loaded concurrently, what was the stacks of the threads at the time the timeout occured, etc. I entered bug 81423 and will close this one for lack of information.

Bug.Summery: [wording] Occurrences get reset on mouse click
Bug.WithStack:
I have mark occurrences disabled, so that I can invoke it manually using ALT+SHIFT+O. But, once I have marked them using the command, the marks get lost as soon as I single-click anywhere in the editor. Single-click is used to place the caret, so this is a form of overloading and shouldn't be done. Mark Occurrences does the same as when you enable the feature via mouse i.e. when you click it recomputes. What you're looking for is one of the (too, I know) many preferences: in 3.0.x: Java > Editor > Mark Occurrens [ ] Sticky
in I20041214-2000: Java > Editor, Mark Occurrens [ ] Keep marks when the selection changes
Note: You could also use Search > Occurrens (Ctrl+Shift+U) which places the results in the Search view.
That preference is disabled, but checked, and still it doesn't help. If I enable "Mark occurence in file", and "Sticky", I still see the exact same behavior. When I click, the markings change.
It sounds like there is a new preference in 3.1. Hopefully, this preference setting can be changed even when "Mark occurences in file" is turned off. You all should reconsider the labels for these preferences. Alt+Shift+O doesn't mark occurrences it toggles whether the feature is enabled or not. There's no key binding to mark the occurrences for a given caret location. To do this you have to use Ctrl+Shift+U (Search Occurrences). I dont' know of any other preference that has an accelerator, but that doesn't mean it's not a good thing. However, it would make sense to display the keybinding in the preference page, and to call the command "Toggle Mark Occurrences" which to me suggests that it is flipping a bit, vs. invoking a one- time Action. I've updated the label. Is there API from UI to obtain a keybinding as a string? Yes there is but it's against Eclipse style to show them in the tool bar hovers (no one does it). I was suggesting a message below the checkbox control on the preference page. This would be the first place where we show a short cut on a preference page. Adding preference dynamic team member to cc-list for comment.

Bug.Summery: Strange behavior for HEAD tag in on-the-fly filter

Lines.Line: 1) Select it and click "Switch to another branch or version"
2) Click "Select tag from the following list"
2) In the filter text field, type "HEAD" and hit TAB.
-> Observation: the tree viewer only contains the HEAD tag and it is framed, but
not selected!

Bug.WithStack:
Version: 3.1.0 Build id: 200412142000
Prerequisites: Have a shared project (e.g. team.core) in another branch than HEAD checked out in your workspace
1) Select it and click "Switch to another branch or version" 2) Click "Select tag from the following list" 2) In the filter text field, type "HEAD" and hit TAB. -> Observation: the tree viewer only contains the HEAD tag and it is framed, but not selected!
3) Hit ENTER -> Observation: Something is fetched from the server (or at least an attempt is made), but the project is not switched to HEAD and remains in the branch.
For some reason, above steps work for any other branch/version name than HEAD. Fix released to HEAD
Bug.WithOutStack:
Version: 3.1.0 Build id: 200412142000
Prerequisites: Have a shared project (e.g. team.core) in another branch than HEAD checked out in your workspace
1) Select it and click "Switch to another branch or version" 2) Click "Select tag from the following list" 2) In the filter text field, type "HEAD" and hit TAB. -> Observation: the tree viewer only contains the HEAD tag and it is framed, but not selected!
3) Hit ENTER -> Observation: Something is fetched from the server (or at least an attempt is made), but the project is not switched to HEAD and remains in the branch.
For some reason, above steps work for any other branch/version name than HEAD. Fix released to HEAD

Bug.Summery: Display the actual timestamp on the Sequence diagram rather than the delta
Bug.WithStack:
The time bar shows delta time on flyover but it is more intelligible if the actual timestamp is displayed in the diagram. It would be useful to allow the display format to be chosen as an option ( day / hour / minutes / second )
As a workaround today, you can get to the time using the search function in the sequence diagram view. Thanks to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=75248 that has been fixed in 3.2, you can see at what time (relative to the agent start) occurs a method invocation or return. Talking with Eric, looks like this request was for Log Interactions, not for Trace Interactions. We probably need to reopen it and set a meeting including Eugene, don't we? There is also timestamp and message information displayed in property view on a log event selection. Timestamp cannot be shown in the time bar as it has no meaning on the node in between 2 node, and it was mean to show a time duration, but not an actual time. With enlightments from Eugene, what should we do Christine? Change the status back to Resolved or organize a meeting?

Bug.Summery: [plug-in registry] Plugin registry view does not behave well in the case of dynamic changes

Lines.Line: 1. RegistryBrowserListener should not navigate tree using TreeItem widgets like it happens to do now, but should use model.
2. There are some cache maps in RegistryBrowserContentProvider that make it hard to update model directly. I'll ideally move them to respective nodes.

Bug.WithStack:
i200412142000
(see related bug 81201)
I don't know what is the intended behavior for the plugin registry view in face of dynamic changes to the set of installed plug-ins.
With the current implementation, the PDE/UI view might choke trying to process change events as they come. The root of the problem here is the fact that change events are not batched, and they are sent after the fact. So listeners need to be careful and not make any assumptions about the state of the extension registry/framework when they are handling a single event.
In the case of the plugin registry, the safest thing to do would be to just to discard all the information kept about the plug-in registry when an event comes and to schedule a job to rebuild it asynchronously. If another event comes, that job should be cancelled and rescheduled for later on. At some point, bundle events/registry change events will stop to come and the job will be able to rebuild the model.
Or, as suggested by Pascal, PDE UI could stop using the IPluginRegistry API and provide the same information by processing the extension registry and the set of bundles available through its BundleContext. I believe this is in the plan for PDE to become a BDE sometime in the future. I got this NPE after uninstalling a plug-in required by others and refreshing.

Bug.Summery: PDE JUnit cannot find the class when the Plugin being tested has a plugin class
Bug.WithStack:
A class not found occurs in the following scenario: You have 2 plugins one plugin contains the classes that extend JUnit TestCase and test Classes that are in the Plugin being tested. The plugin that contains the test code contains an import to the plugin being tested. The plugin being tested contains a plugin class as defined in the plugin.xml class statement. When the Unit test are executed with PDE Junit the classes in the plugin being tested cannot be found. However when you remove the plugin class from the plugin.xml file of the plugin being tested the classes are found. This was an environment issue. I am retracting the defect.
Sorry...

Bug.Summery: Exiting while debugging same JRE build
Bug.WithStack:
Attempting to exit Eclipse while debugging a same JRE build will result in a security exception.
Ant in the same JRE installs a SecurityManager that does not allow System.exit ()
This problem has always been there but is more likely now that the user can suspend a build. Fix with the changes to the security manager of 60860. Changes to the AntSecurityManager (with bug 60860 as well) to be "thread" based. Only bong for the Ant thread.
The InternalAntRunner only fires buildFinished if the AntCore plugin is active.
The AntProcessBuildLogger does not log messages if the exception that causes the build to finished was an OperationCancelledException Please verify Kevin. verified
Bug.WithOutStack:
Attempting to exit Eclipse while debugging a same JRE build will result in a security exception.
Ant in the same JRE installs a SecurityManager that does not allow System.exit ()
This problem has always been there but is more likely now that the user can suspend a build. Fix with the changes to the security manager of 60860. Changes to the AntSecurityManager (with bug 60860 as well) to be "thread" based. Only bong for the Ant thread.
The InternalAntRunner only fires buildFinished if the AntCore plugin is active.
The AntProcessBuildLogger does not log messages if the exception that causes the build to finished was an OperationCancelledException Please verify Kevin. verified

Bug.Summery: missing classes in a jar file
Bug.WithStack:
I am working for a small company called CID employed by Brigham Young University. We are currently building a project that involves JFace. According to the API (and our feeble attempts to run our program), there are some classes that are not included in the JFace jar, nor could we find them in the CVS repository. Some of those classes are: BadLocationException IRegion ITypedRegion IDocument and I believe there are more. We are totally perplexed and unless we are doing something wrong, believe that this is a bug. If those classes can be found somewhere, great, and please let us know. I have googled, searched through directories and poured through repository versions, but cannot find them for the life of me.
Thank you for the most awesome product. We here at the CID would be completely satisfied if Eclipse was our OS. We love it. Thanks for the help. I believe those classes are in the jface.text plugin, not the jface plugin. Please reopen if that's not the case (I have no way to confirm at the moment). You are right, but I meant the jfacetext.jar. I have looked through both jars and have not been able to locate the classes. When I import the jars into my eclipse build path, and try to create a TextViewer, it throws a NoClassDefFoundException for BadLocationException. If I make up a phony BadLocationException, it throws the same exception for IRegion. I am sure that it does work for you and I know that it works for all the people that have written books about it, but it doesn't work for us.
If you want I can send you the entire contents of the jfacetext.jar, but...
Anyway, thanks again. Okay, I finally found the classes tucked away in the org.eclipse.text plugin (which I don't think anyone would have looked for when using JFace). I certainly hope that this helps other people as I have spent a long time today looking for these classes. Anyway, when I looked in the org.eclipse.platform.source_3.0.0\src\org.eclipse.jface.text_3.0.0, I was not able to find the code that I was looking for, but in org.eclipse.platform.source_3.0.0\src\org.eclipse.text_3.0.0, there were two folders once unzipped, text and jface. I don't quite understand why it is not with the other jface stuff, but I am just glad I found it and can continue working on my project.
Again, Eclipse is the coolest thing to happen to computers. I love it!!! Some background why it's the way it's now: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-text-home/development/splitting/PrereleaseNote.html

Bug.Summery: Debugging fails on Ant older than 1.6
Bug.WithStack:
Buildfile: c:\darins\workspaces\runtime-workspace\3.1 Features\debugEcho.xml default: BUILD FAILED: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.tools.ant.Location.getLineNumber()I Total time: 561 milliseconds The Location.getLineNumber method was only added in Ant 1.6
I believe we can work around this using Location.toString and parsing out the lineNumber
Known limitation for M4 The convience methods for fileName and lineNumber on Location were added in 1.6. Needed to revert for older Ants to parsing the Location.toString().
Changes to AntProcessDebugBuildLogger, RemoteAntBreakpoint, RemoteAntDebugBuildLogger. Please verify DarinW. Verified.

Bug.Summery: [GlobalActions] "Open Resource" dialog doesn't filters out class files?

Lines.Line: 1. Press ctrl+shift+r to open the "Open Resource" dialog.
2. Type the name of a class file in the workspace (for example, "Hello.class").
3. The dialog does not show the class file, even though it exists.

Bug.WithStack:
Build 20041214-2000
1. Press ctrl+shift+r to open the "Open Resource" dialog. 2. Type the name of a class file in the workspace (for example, "Hello.class"). 3. The dialog does not show the class file, even though it exists.
In my case, I did this with a simple "Hello World" program in the default package. Hello.java and Hello.class were in the same directory, but the dialog could only find Hello.java. I believe this is intentional...this went in sometime back. Nick, were you the one that made this change? I seem to recall you discussing it... Yes, it's intentional. See bug 60832. If needed, we could add a checkbox here, but I'd prefer not to. Why would you want to open the .class file if you have the .java file?
Because I needed to open a .class file editor. :)
Can you please at least provide a checkbox as you mentioned? I don't think the dialog should prevent me from opening a file just because it seems like a strange thing to do. :) Having the checkbox will at least help explain the filtering, even if the user doesn't change the setting.
"Show derived resources" checkbox added (default is unchecked).
Subclasses of ResourceListSelectionDialog can choose whether this checkbox is shown using setAllowUserToToggleDerived(boolean). Default is false so as not to hose existing subclasses, such as the Package Explorer's GotoResourceDialog, which wants to always hide derived resources (they're not in the Java model). Dirk, this means there is no change to the current behaviour for PE. Please let me know if this is not what you want.
The OpenResourceDialog and the Navigator's GotoResourceDialog show the toggle, and persist the setting in the IDE plugin's dialog settings store (shared setting for the two dialogs).
Actually, we're late in M5 so I'm going to hold off and release this after it's declared.
Created attachment 18066 Patch to o.e.ui.ide Created attachment 18068 Previous patch had some unwanted changes Patch applied.
Verified in I20050331-0800.

Bug.Summery: [api] Missing TypedListeners or Javadoc for MeasureItem, EraseItem, PaintItem, SetData, and Close, Dispose, OpenDocument, Settings, Skin

source_code.code: /** * Sent when the size of a cell's content is needed. * * @param e an event containing information about the */

Lines.Line: - @param is incomplete
- Description seems inappropriate
- What are implementations supposed to do?
- Does SWT erase the item to defaults (including selection bg color) or does the client have to do this?

- How should the client react to itemMeasured(..)? I guess he should fill in some fields of the passed ItemEvent -- if so, then this must be specified. Furthermore, "itemMeasured" sounds like a notification. It should more sound like a command if the client is supposed to do something (e.g. "measureItem").
NOTE: The patch was developed by a coop and has not been reviewed. See comment #7.
Could this please go in before the API freeze?
Created attachment 61001
addition of MouseWheel and MenuDetect (final)

Bug.WithStack:
Missing TypedListeners for:
DragDetect SetData MenuDetect MouseWheel Assigning to Veronika because I seem to be incapable of typing in the classes. Adding [consistency] to title and keyword.
Also note that the typed listener classes are a great place to hang doc. For example, nowhere in all the current code is any example of how to do virtual tables/trees - you have to look at snippets or read the Table/Tree code to figure it out. SetDataListener, SetDataEvent, and addSetDataListener are all good places for virtual table/tree javadoc and a small example.
Also, typed listeners show which widgets you can hook certain events to. For example, can you add a MenuDetect listener to a Menu? Can you hook MouseWheel to a Tracker? The add...Listener methods help people from making wierd mistakes and wondering why they never get their expected event.
The event classes help to show which fields are valid. SetData only cares about the item field, but you have to read the code to know that...
HardKeyDown/Up are also missing TypedListeners, but we should probably leave them alone because they are only used on a small number of platforms (1?). *** Bug 128375 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Additional missing typed listeners in HEAD:
Settings EraseItem MeasureItem PaintItem Could these please be added now that the API freeze is over? Yes, assigning this to Grant. I seem to still be incapable of adding this boiler-plate. Created attachment 56850 patch
Patch from Masha. It has not been reviewed or tested yet. The patch from comment 7 also contains unrelated and unfinished changes for org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Tracker.java I forgot about that, don't apply the Tracker changes.
DragDetectEvent and DragDetectListener have been added. This should really go into 3.3. Please note that this is not just boilerplate. It's the *only* API specification for these features. Constants declarations in the SWT class alone do not constitute an API.
I just looked into ItemListener, and found that the method Javadocs need more work. E.g.
/** * Sent when the size of a cell's content is needed. * * @param e an event containing information about the */ public void itemErased(ItemEvent e);
- @param is incomplete - Description seems inappropriate - What are implementations supposed to do? - Does SWT erase the item to defaults (including selection bg color) or does the client have to do this? - How should the client react to itemMeasured(..)? I guess he should fill in some fields of the passed ItemEvent -- if so, then this must be specified. Furthermore, "itemMeasured" sounds like a notification. It should more sound like a command if the client is supposed to do something (e.g. "measureItem"). NOTE: The patch was developed by a coop and has not been reviewed. See comment #7. Could this please go in before the API freeze? Created attachment 61001 addition of MouseWheel and MenuDetect (final)
Attached is a patch that adds typed events/listeners for MouseWheel and MenuDetect. It's attached here first because PMC approval is needed to change api at this stage. I'll be posting a request to the PMC list shortly.
The TypedEvents in the patch for Display (Close, Dispose, Settings) were not added because the typed listener mechanism currently cannot be used on non-widgets. It's possible that this could be changed, but not at this stage.
The TypedEvents in the patch for Table/Tree were not added because after discussion with others it was decided that these may not be in their final forms yet (ie.- could grow post-3.3), and do not want to introduce api that could soon require an extension. I think the javadoc for MenuDetect is wrong. The event x and y in this case are display-relative, not widget relative. +1 to adding the API Susan you're right, thanks for catching this! I'll update this when the patch is committed (starting now).
fyi...there is some new JFace API that will make use the typed listener for MenuDetect, so please let us know as soon as this is available in HEAD (see bug #176198) MouseWheel and MenuDetect are released.
Keeping the report open for future consideration of the other typed listeners that were not added.
found a typo (while copying the menu detect javadoc to jface)... on the remove menu detect listener call, "specific" is spelled wrong.
platform-secific fixed, thanks again Susan! Is this fixed? If not, what is missing. Are we going to address for 3.5?
The custom draw stuff (MeasureItem, EraseItem and PaintItem) is still missing. See bug 312315. http://www.eclipse.org/articles/article.php?file=Article-CustomDrawingTableAndTreeItems/index.html and SWT snippets already contain some usage examples. (In reply to Carolyn MacLeod from comment #24) > The custom draw stuff (MeasureItem, EraseItem and PaintItem) is still > missing.
And SetData. And the Display events Close, Dispose, OpenDocument, Settings, Skin should also also documented, e.g. in the SWT#xxx event declaration itself.

For one of my Java editors, when I turn off Mark Occurances, the results disappear from the BEV but remain in the editor. They still remain in the editor after toggling the button a couple of times.
Sorry, I don't think that I can reproduce this problem. My other editors work Ok. There is nothing in the log file. Anything in .log? We also noticed having cheese sometimes lately but it always went away when clicking on another Java element in the text. Didn't try the tool bar button though.

Bug.Summery: Switching logs makes the log get analyzed twice

Lines.Line: 1. import an Apache access log and an error log
2. import a symptom database and modify a couple of rules to make sure the
analysis engine will find a few matches for both logs
3. create a correlation of these two logs
4. open the correlation in the log view and Analyze All
5. double click one log

Bug.WithStack:
1. import an Apache access log and an error log 2. import a symptom database and modify a couple of rules to make sure the analysis engine will find a few matches for both logs 3. create a correlation of these two logs 4. open the correlation in the log view and Analyze All 5. double click one log
According to the status bar, this log was analyzed twice before it was shown in the log view fixs submitted in HEAD closing the defect

Bug.Summery: platform source missing from RCP SDK drops
Bug.WithStack: I just noticed in i1214 that the RCP SDK drop is missing the platform.source.xxx fragment. This is the platform-specific source and in particular, the source for SWT. (there are some other fragments missing source but they are less important). Note that the platform.source plugin is included but it does not contain the SWT source. Is this just an omission or is there an issue here? This is an omission. The RCP SDK feature is missing all the platform specific source fragments (thus the swt source which is platform specific). Fixed.

(there are some other fragments missing source but they are less important). Note that the platform.source plugin is included but it does not contain the SWT source. Is this just an omission or is there an issue here? This is an omission. The RCP SDK feature is missing all the platform specific source fragments (thus the swt source which is platform specific). Fixed.

Bug.Summery: [Decorators] Decorators changing fonts in trees?
Bug.WithStack:
I200412142000
Attached is a screenshot of the export to archive file wizard. I have set a dialog font to be something large, and the tree inherits this. However, some rows use the normal-sized font. I assume this has to do with decorators setting fonts. Created attachment 16683 Screenshot Looks like the CVS decorator is setting the font somehow. Yes, the CVS decorator sets the font. It uses the UI theme support to obtain the font that it to be used. This is due to the CVS decorator.

Bug.Summery: [breakpoints] Allow copy/paste of exception inclusion/exclusion filters
Bug.WithStack:
It's very tedious to build up a collection of inclusion/exclusion filters for an exception breakpoint. If you then decide that you want to be catching a different exception, you have to create the filters all over again.
We should allow for copy/paste of the filters, even if the inclusion/exclusion status isn't maintained (it would be okay if they all get pasted as "enabled"). Currently deferred *** Bug 134514 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

It's very tedious to build up a collection of inclusion/exclusion filters for an exception breakpoint. If you then decide that you want to be catching a different exception, you have to create the filters all over again.

Bug.Summery: merge hangs updating revision histories

Lines.Line: 1) Follow the steps at this URL to get a trace of the communications between
the client and server:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm-
home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0
2) Start eclipse with java.exe and -consolelog -debug (as required for step 1)
and do a CTRL-BREAK when Eclipse is blocked so we can see where the wait is
occurring.

Bug.WithStack:
Merges fail with a CVS timeout even when merging a small project. I've upped the timeout several times (currently I have it set to five minutes) and it always fails suggesting that I increase the timeout yet more. I haven't gone farther than 10 minutes, but there's no relief in sight... My project *does* have a lot of labels (from daily builds). But the number of these increases slowly, so I would have expected a slow degredation in performance rather than what seems to be a somewhat catastrophic one... I would be happy to provide more useful details, but I'm not sure where to start -- please let me know what would help. There's two thinsg you can do:
1) Follow the steps at this URL to get a trace of the communications between the client and server:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm- home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0
2) Start eclipse with java.exe and -consolelog -debug (as required for step 1) and do a CTRL-BREAK when Eclipse is blocked so we can see where the wait is occurring.
Attach the output from these 2 steps to this bug. Also, what CVS server version are you using? Waiting for reponse from reporter I'm sorry -- I've been on holiday and so it's taken me a while to get back to this. I've done as you asked and to my chagrin discovered the problem is we're running CVS version 1.11 instead of 1.11.1p1. I'm currently upgrading and expect the problem to be resolved. So I'm going to spend a little time cleaning the egg off my face and checking with the new server version -- if the problem does *not* resolve, I'll re-open with the trace using the new server. Our usual practice is to move bugs to the RESOLVED REMIND state when there is not enough information provided to address the reported issue and more information has been requested. This bug has been in the RESOLVED REMIND state for quite some time so it is being CLOSED. If you can provide the requested information or you otherwise feel that this is still an issue, please reopen the bug. If you are unable to open it due to a lack or permissions, please add a comment to the bug stating that you would like to have the request reconsidered. I applogize for this blanket approach to bug screening but there are just to many bugs in the REMIND state for us to effectively triage them. Your help in this matter is appreciated. [REMIND->INVALID] The "REMIND" bugzilla resolution is being removed so reopening to mark as INVALID. INVALID. Closing.

Bug.Summery: Datapoo: context menu "Select Datapool in Test Navigator" doesn't work
Log View doesn't notify listeners view-selection-changed when user clicks Page down or page up button

Lines.Line: 1. import an Apache access log and an error log
2. create a correlation of these two logs and open the log interactions view on
it
3. click an event in the log view, the selection is synchronized in the log
interactions view
4. click Page down, the first event of the next page gets selected

Bug.WithStack:
1. import an Apache access log and an error log 2. create a correlation of these two logs and open the log interactions view on it 3. click an event in the log view, the selection is synchronized in the log interactions view 4. click Page down, the first event of the next page gets selected
But the selection in the log interactions view doesn't get updated.
Suggest fix:
LogViewer.setSelectionOnPageLoad
+ LogUtil.notifyViewSelectionChanged() Terry, please investigate the problem Patch submitted in HEAD closing the defect

Bug.Summery: Refactoring logs exception from JavaReconciler
Bug.WithStack:
Playing around with refactoring a class by just renaming it back and forth between "Hello" and "Hello2", I very often (> 50% of the time), hit the following exception.
All I got in the log was the following: !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 368 2004-12-15 14:41:17.662 !MESSAGE Resource /Java/Hello.java does not exist.
But I was able to debug to see it was getting logged from JDT UI (not org.eclipse.core.resources as the log entry says) like so:
Thread [org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.text.JavaReconciler] (Suspended (breakpoint at line 56 in Log)) Log.log(IStatus) line: 56 JavaPlugin.log(IStatus) line: 292 JavaSpellingReconcileStrategy.getContentType() line: 161 JavaSpellingReconcileStrategy.reconcile(IRegion) line: 142 JavaCompositeReconcilingStrategy(CompositeReconcilingStrategy).reconcile(IRegion) line: 86 JavaCompositeReconcilingStrategy.reconcile(IRegion) line: 94 JavaReconciler(MonoReconciler).process(DirtyRegion) line: 75 JavaReconciler.process(DirtyRegion) line: 318 AbstractReconciler$BackgroundThread.run() line: 204 Christof please investigate. Fixed in builds >= I200412160800 Verified in I20041216-2000 through code inspection.

Bug.Summery: [nls tooling] Properties File editor does not properly color continuation lines
Bug.WithStack:
I20041214-2000
prop.properties: ---------------- key1= value\n key2= value2 key3= value3\n\ continued value2 on this line\ and even on third line key4= ----------------
The syntax coloring does not consider the continuation character '\' at the end of lines any more and thus wrongly renders 'continued' and 'and' in black.
Earlier builds used to render key2 in blue but were otherwise correct for this example. Probably related to the changes in PatternRule. 3.1 M4 candidate. Marking as major: if the change in PatternRule caused this then other editors might be affected as well. Fixed by Kai. Available in builds >= I20041216-0800 . The fix caused grief at other places and had to be pulled out from I20041216-0800. Fixed in HEAD. Will be released into I20041216-1600 Verified in I20041216-2000.

I20041214-2000

Earlier builds used to render key2 in blue but were otherwise correct for this example. Probably related to the changes in PatternRule. 3.1 M4 candidate. Marking as major: if the change in PatternRule caused this then other editors might be affected as well. Fixed by Kai. Available in builds >= I20041216-0800 . The fix caused grief at other places and had to be pulled out from I20041216-0800. Fixed in HEAD. Will be released into I20041216-1600 Verified in I20041216-2000.

Bug.Summery: CDT adds only one register group – “main”
Bug.WithStack:
Our beta product is based on CDT 2.0.2 and that version CDT simply inserts one register group - "main". Adding multiple registry groups is pretty important usability feature for out customers so we modified CDT and GDB to support multiple registry groups.
The way I did it was by adding custom MI/GDB command that returns the registry groups and the association between a group and a register. At that time I propose the change but it was rejected since it was based on custom MI/GDB command.
If there is no plan right now I can rework my implementation. I can define an extension point that provides registry grouping and not rely on custom MI/GDB command. There will be a default extension implementation that will add the "main" group. Other plugin can add their own registry grouping providers. Wrong category, this is an debug issue.
And Alexiev, you forgot the patch 8) I'll submit it by 4 o-clock. I want to make sure it applies agains HEAD. I am currently working agains CDT_2_0_2.
> I'll submit it by 4 o-clock. > I want to make sure it applies agains HEAD. > I am currently working agains CDT_2_0_2.
Ho! sorry, no rush/worries. I thought you forgot to attach the patch.
Created attachment 16721 patch for 81351 for CDT2_0_2
This patch is for register group support of in CDT. It is based on custom MI/GDB command. It is applicable for CDT2_0_2. Sorry, I didn’t have chance to check it against the HEAD. I am out of the office from Dec 18 to Jan 2. I wanted to submit the patch before I go to vacation. I am at the office on Dec 17 up to 4 o’clock EST. We will setup the HEAD stream in our office in January and still need some time to get familiar with the changes in the debug model done since CDT_2_0_2.
Also, this is my first multiple file and adding new files patch. Let me know if I don’t do something right. I posted a question to the GDB mailing list for support about register groups. http://sources.redhat.com/ml/gdb/2004-12/msg00095.html I found already opened entry for that since 2002-11-25. "850 - Missing MI interface to register groups from"
(In reply to comment #5) > I posted a question to the GDB mailing list for support about register groups. > http://sources.redhat.com/ml/gdb/2004-12/msg00095.html > I found already opened entry for that since 2002-11-25. > "850 - Missing MI interface to register groups from" >

Bug.WithOutStack:
Our beta product is based on CDT 2.0.2 and that version CDT simply inserts one register group - "main". Adding multiple registry groups is pretty important usability feature for out customers so we modified CDT and GDB to support multiple registry groups.
The way I did it was by adding custom MI/GDB command that returns the registry groups and the association between a group and a register. At that time I propose the change but it was rejected since it was based on custom MI/GDB command.
If there is no plan right now I can rework my implementation. I can define an extension point that provides registry grouping and not rely on custom MI/GDB command. There will be a default extension implementation that will add the "main" group. Other plugin can add their own registry grouping providers. Wrong category, this is an debug issue.

Bug.Summery: Automatic switch of instruction stepping mode
Bug.WithStack:
As part of our beta product we implemented a feature that automatically switches between instruction level debugging and source level debugging based on which view or editor is currently active.
I think many embedded IDEs have similar behavior since it is pretty common to debug machine instructions. Many of the customers don't have the source code so it makes sense for them to often switch between assembly and C debugging, but the current CDT requires the user to manually trigger the instruction stepping mode on and off.
We enhanced CDT to automatically switch between instruction and source stepping mode biased on the active view or editor or keyboard focus. If the user clicks or activates the disassembly view the stepping mode automatically becomes instruction stepping. If the user clicks or activates a source editor it will turn off instruction stepping and go to source stepping.
In case some users are not happy with the automatic behavior we have a toolbar and a menu that turns on/off the automatic switch.
If people think that these features are valuable for the general user or if we need a way to augment this feature I am ready to submit the changes I did. Wrong component
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 79872 ***

Bug.Summery: automatically opening of the disassembly window
Bug.WithStack:
We added a feature to CDT that automatically opens the disassembly window if the target is halted and there is no source line associated with the current PC. Correctly me if I am wrong, but I think that in that case CDT only updates the disassembly window but doesn't try to open or activate it.
If people think that these features are valuable for the general user or if we need a way to augment this feature I am ready to submit the changes I did. Debug component Good point. We had this feature before, but it was lost when we switched to the disassembly view. Fixed. *** Bug 94450 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** The fix was for https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=94450. Reopening. Because disassembly display is not something that's handled in the editor area, but by a dedicated view, I think we need to consider that the automatic opening of the disassembly view may come across as disruptive to some users, as the view will acquire a substantial amount of the limited real-estate in the workbench. Some users will not care about seeing disassembly if the topmost stack frame ends up suddenly being in a function with no debug info. They would be fine simply stepping out of the function up to where there is debug-info (source). They should be able to do that without also having to go close a view that automatically popped up.
For this reason, I request that the implementation for this bugzilla entry include the addition of a global setting which will allow the user to avoid the behavior.
(In reply to comment #6) > For this reason, I request that the implementation for this bugzilla entry > include the addition of a global setting which will allow the user to avoid the > behavior. No question about that. It wasn't mentioned in the description but had been always assumed.
Mikhail, one of our customers is really complaining about this now, do you mind if I have a look at it for CDT 4.0? No problem. Any progress ? Sorry, ran out of time to fix this for 4.0, it's on my short list for 4.0.1. I've committed changes so that when a thread is suspended in a location with no source code it now opens the source not found editor. The source not found editor has been extended to handle the case when there is no source in addition to when the source can't be located. This editor now includes a "View Disassembly" button that opens the Disassembly View. These changes help with the confusion experienced when you land in code with no source but remain looking at whatever editor was last active.
I think this is OK in the context of CDT 4.0.1 and I'm marking this fixed, but the right way to handle this is to have a disassembly editor: bug 196064. Let's move further discussion of disassembly in CDT there.

Bug.Summery: TableColumn.setText("") results in screen cheese
Bug.WithStack:
Passing the empty string to TableColumn.setText on windows inserts a bunch of gibberish characters into the table heading.
This appears to be because TCHAR is not null-terminating zero length strings when given the terminate=true argument. Created attachment 16685 Fix for this bug
Adds the missing null-terminator to TCHAR *** Bug 81004 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Great catch Stefan! I'm so embarassed ... Bug.Summery: stringList does not support a browseType of file
Bug.WithStack:
When modifying the UI for the CDT build options, contents of stringList can be lost if the browseType is set to "file".
The following option is an example that causes the contents of stringList to be lost if you enter a value when browsing, and you next click on the optionCategory and back to the original stringList UI:
<option valueType="stringList" category="gnu.c.link.category.files" browseType="file" name="%Option.Linker.LinkerScript" id="gnu.c.link.option.linkerscripts"/>
works correctly if you change valueType to userObjs:
<option valueType="userObjs" category="gnu.c.link.category.files" browseType="file" name="%Option.Linker.LinkerScript" id="gnu.c.link.option.linkerscripts"/>
Here is the entire option category: <optionCategory owner="cdt.managedbuild.tool.gnu.c.linker" name="%OptionCategory.Files" id="gnu.c.link.category.files"/> <option valueType="userObjs" category="gnu.c.link.category.files" browseType="file" name="%Option.Linker.LinkerScript" id="gnu.c.link.option.linkerscripts"/> <option command="-Wl,-cref,-Map," valueType="string" category="gnu.c.link.category.files" name="%Option.Linker.MapFile" id="gnu.c.link.option.mapfile"/> redirected to build I have not been able to reproduce this problem, although I have been doing my experimentation on Linux. Can you still reproduce the problem? I have been trying to reproduce the problem with CDT 3.01 as well as with CDT 2.1.
The instructions on how to reproduce the problem are not clear to me, so I am not sure what the current status of the issue is:
>> ...an example that causes the contents of stringList to >> be lost if you enter a value when browsing, and you next click on the >> optionCategory and back to the original stringList UI
I enter a value for a file while browsing, as directed. Next, the directions state that I should click on the optionCategory. I cannot click on the optionCategory value until the browse dialog sequence is completed and dismissed, so it is unclear what to do at this step. I have tried numerous possibilites, such as completing the browse dialog sequence by accepting the file selection and completing the browse dialog sequence and then selecting the optionCategory value, but I cannot reproduce a problem.
Could you either confirm that the problem has been resolved or clarify the instructions on how to reproduce the problem?
Thanks,
Bob No further help from the reporter so I'm assuming this works. Marking as WORKSFORME

The operation should be disabled and not bound in the UI if it is not supported. My opinion is this bug was opened because exceptions were being thrown, and that has been fixed. A new bug should be opened for the issue that Occurrences in File should be disabled for external files.

duplicate of this bug. *** In RC3 with just the HTML transitional template contents, setting the cleanup dialog to only alter the tag or attribute name case results in no changes. In 0.7.0, "alter the tag or attribute name case" effects zero, because HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl fails to overwrite/extend inherited function getCleanupPreferences(). CleanupProcessorXML (the class from which HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl is derived) doesn't know "alter the tag or attribute name case". I solved that in my installation, but I see in webCVS that HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl.java has experienced major changes, so my patch isn't needed anymore/won't do any good. i no longer see the original bug and in regards to comment #2 and comment #3 bug 104562 fixed the problem. close

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2004-12-15 19:08:40.164 !MESSAGE The command for the key you pressed failed
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2004-12-15 19:08:40.164 !MESSAGE The command for the key you pressed failed !STACK 0
*** Bug 105349 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** In RC3 with just the HTML transitional template contents, setting the cleanup dialog to only alter the tag or attribute name case results in no changes. In 0.7.0, "alter the tag or attribute name case" effects zero, because HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl fails to overwrite/extend inherited function getCleanupPreferences(). CleanupProcessorXML (the class from which HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl is derived) doesn't know "alter the tag or attribute name case". I solved that in my installation, but I see in webCVS that HTMLCleanupProcessorImpl.java has experienced major changes, so my patch isn't needed anymore/won't do any good. i no longer see the original bug and in regards to comment #2 and comment #3 bug 104562 fixed the problem. close

Bug.Summery: [select] Hovering over colon in case statement shows details of previous element
Can't find source for IJavaStratumLineBreakpoint with Tomcat 5.5 and Java5
Bug.WithStack:
Breakpoints I set using the Webtools JSP editor work properly with Tomcat 5.0.25 and JDK 1.4.2_05. Switching to Tomcat 5.5.4 and Java5 1.5.0, all other things being equal, it still breaks and steps with local variables made visible, but the source (Default, Java, or JSP) can't be found. The same result occurs using the Sysdeo Tomcat plugin and the Webtools Server tools.
Where the IResource res = the .jsp source file, the arguments sent to the JDIDebugModel are:
JDIDebugModel.createStratumBreakpoint(res, "JSP", res.getName(), null, "*jsp", lineNumber, someOffsetOnThatLine, sameOffsetOnThatLine, 0, true, null); Can you try to narrow the problem down to the version of Tomcat or the JDK? You said: Tomcat 5.0.25 + JDK 1.4.2 - fine Tomcat 5.5.4 + JDK 1.5.0 - bad But what about: Tomcat 5.0.25 + JDK 1.5.0 - ? Tomcat 5.5.4 + JDK 1.4.2 - ?
We're not Tomcat/JSP kind of people, so any additional info you can give us would be great. :) Tomcat 5.5.x requires a Java5 runtime.
It must have been a quirk because Tomcat 5.5.4 works with the javafamily example launcher now. Closing.

Bug.Summery: AllTypesCache does not know about Enums and Annotations -> wrong icon in Open Type...
Bug.WithStack:
I20041216-0010
The AllTypesCache does not know about Enums and Annotations. Therefore, the Open Type dialog shows wrong icons for Annotations (e.g. SuppressWarnings) and Enums (e.g. Thread.State). Opened bug agains JDT/Core to provide necessary information. Got addressed for M6.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20041216-0010
The AllTypesCache does not know about Enums and Annotations. Therefore, the Open Type dialog shows wrong icons for Annotations (e.g. SuppressWarnings) and Enums (e.g. Thread.State). Opened bug agains JDT/Core to provide necessary information. Got addressed for M6.

Bug.Summery: Ant and External tools tutuorial updates
Bug.WithStack:
Not sure about the component "Ant" or "Doc" ...
I startet the "Ant & external tools tutorial" pp 82 and found some errors:
- p.83, step 5+11 <tar could be completed to <tar>, too (as suggested by Eclipse) Could come from prior Ant1.6 time ... Since 1.6 you can use every (sorry not <subant>) task on top level.
- Step 7 is not clear. I assumed that you should insert <echo>World</echo> but to get that Outline View you have to insert <property name="World Text" value="World"></property> <target name="World"> <echo>${World Text}</echo> </target>
- In the example code you use define a property ${Hello Text} with a blank which is valid. But you use a ${HelloText} without blank. I recommend changing the definition.
- p86 step 1: the correct menu is "Run > External Tools > External Tools..." instead of "Run > External Tools..." I fixed the text errors..thanks.
The pictures need updating for 3.1 etc and the error in ${Hello Text} and ${HelloText} but we will revisit near the end of 3.1.
Changes to qs-83_edit.htm and qs-84_run_ant.htm As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: Package Explorer working set mode can't be restored anymore

Lines.Line: - create project
- go into this project
- press go up to show all projects again
- switch to working set mode
- close Eclipe
- restart

Bug.WithStack:
M4 test pass
- create project - go into this project - press go up to show all projects again - switch to working set mode - close Eclipe - restart
observe: Package explorer comes up in project mode again.
Even if you switch to working set mode again the package explorer will be in project mode on every restart.
Problem is that the package explorer restores the last frame on restart which in this case is alwasy the JavaModel. Fixed for M4. Verified in I200412160800.
Bug.WithOutStack:
M4 test pass
- create project - go into this project - press go up to show all projects again - switch to working set mode - close Eclipe - restart
observe: Package explorer comes up in project mode again.
Even if you switch to working set mode again the package explorer will be in project mode on every restart.
Problem is that the package explorer restores the last frame on restart which in this case is alwasy the JavaModel. Fixed for M4. Verified in I200412160800.

Bug.Summery: Add description to ListBoxItem
Bug.WithStack:
Suggest adding more details to the description. original text: Instances of this class represent an item in a ListBox widget.
New text: Instances of this class represent an item in a ListBox widget. When both heading and details are specified, the list item is separated into double columns. Left columns contains heading text and an optional heading icon (headingIcon). Right column contains details and an optional Icon (detailIcon). When the optional heading text is missing, the item can be realized either in single or double column according to the ListBox modifiers, which is implementation-dependent.
When ListBoxItem is used in double line style, headingText must be in the first row and detailText is in the second row. The item can be realized either in single or double column according to the ListBox modifiers, which is implementation-dependent. Proposed description text: Instances of this class represent a selectable user interface object that displays a list of items consisting of text and icons from a data model. Each list item may include combinations of heading text, heading icons, detail text, and detail icons. The layout of the various text and icons is variable depending upon the layout style chosen via the setLayoutStyle method. The LB_STYLE_NO_HEADING style displays detail text (and optionally detail icons) on a single line per item. The LB_STYLE_1LINE_ITEM style displays heading text (and optionally heading icons) in one column and detail text (and optionally detail icons) in a second column. The heading and detail always appear aligned on one row. The LB_STYLE_2LINE_ITEM style displays heading text above detail text in a two line cell. Heading and detail icons are optionally specified using modifier styles. The LB_MOD_SHOW_SELECTION_NUMBER modifier displays a single digit next to each item which indicates that pressing that number selects the item. A list may be single or multi select. The specific placement of item elements is locale and platform-dependent. The model data is provided by an array of ListBoxItems. The array is not copied. The array is used until the ListBox is destroyed or a new data model is set.
Suggest a clarification after "The layout of the various text and icons is variable depending upon the layout style chosen via the setLayoutStyle method."
Add something like: "Styles (LB_STYLE) control visibility of heading and detail text, and modifiers (LB_MOD) control visibility of icons. JavaDoc updated completed

Bug.Summery: HTML not case insensitive by default

Lines.Line: 1) Make a Simple project called "DTDs"
2) Put the attached file into it
Created attachment 16694
test html file
The pairing of start and end tags is partly the responsibility of an
INodeAdapter. In the transition to using FileBuffers, the Structured Document
(with its contents already in place) was set into the model *before* the adapter
factories were added. This prevented this critical function from being in place
during DOM building. Changing the order of initialization repairs it.

Bug.WithStack:
wtp-sdk-N20041216.zip on both Linux-GTK and Win32.
The start and end tags from the attached file do not match up, HTML and TITLE, specifically.
To reproduce: 1) Make a Simple project called "DTDs" 2) Put the attached file into it Created attachment 16694 test html file The pairing of start and end tags is partly the responsibility of an INodeAdapter. In the transition to using FileBuffers, the Structured Document (with its contents already in place) was set into the model *before* the adapter factories were added. This prevented this critical function from being in place during DOM building. Changing the order of initialization repairs it.
Bug 81362 might be related to this. Changes committed to HEAD and released. Verified in 0.7M5, <HTML> and </html> go to the same node in the Outline view.
Bug.WithOutStack:
wtp-sdk-N20041216.zip on both Linux-GTK and Win32.
The start and end tags from the attached file do not match up, HTML and TITLE, specifically.
To reproduce: 1) Make a Simple project called "DTDs" 2) Put the attached file into it Created attachment 16694 test html file The pairing of start and end tags is partly the responsibility of an INodeAdapter. In the transition to using FileBuffers, the Structured Document (with its contents already in place) was set into the model *before* the adapter factories were added. This prevented this critical function from being in place during DOM building. Changing the order of initialization repairs it.
Bug 81362 might be related to this. Changes committed to HEAD and released. Verified in 0.7M5, <HTML> and </html> go to the same node in the Outline view.

Bug.Summery: [1.5][search] Clarify effects of R_ERASURE_MATCH for searches other than TYPE
Bug.WithStack:
I20041216-0010
Javadocs of SearchPattern only talk about the flag R_ERASURE_MATCH in connection with TYPE searches. Bug 81084 indicates that the flag also has effects to other search kinds. The API should describe all intended effects of the new match rules and also tell when the flag should have has no effects. Fixed and released in HEAD. Verified for 3.1M5
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20041216-0010
Javadocs of SearchPattern only talk about the flag R_ERASURE_MATCH in connection with TYPE searches. Bug 81084 indicates that the flag also has effects to other search kinds. The API should describe all intended effects of the new match rules and also tell when the flag should have has no effects. Fixed and released in HEAD. Verified for 3.1M5

Bug.Summery: [1.5][search] Semantics of search for methods with generics

Lines.Line: (1) Search for references to parameterized methods:
References: foo("Eclipse"), foo(new Integer(1))
(2) Search for references to method in parameterized type, where signature
contains the type's type parameter:
Declaration: interface List<E> ... { ... boolean add(E o); ... }
References:
- new ArrayList<String>.add("Eclipse")
- new ArrayList.add("Eclipse")
- new ArrayList.add(new Object())
(3) Search for references to method with generic parameter type:
Declarations: foo(List l), foo(List<String> l)
References: foo(new ArrayList<String>()), foo(new ArrayList())
ok with this three cases, but I would have named them:
1) Search for generic methods (ie. methods with type parameters)
2) Search for methods with type parameter arguments
3) Search for methods with parameterized type arguments
1) Search for generic methods (ie. methods with type parameters)
2) Search for methods with type parameter arguments
3) Search for methods with parameterized type arguments
- new ArrayList<String>.add("Eclipse")
- new ArrayList.add("Eclipse")
- new ArrayList.add(new Object())

Bug.WithStack:
This bug is meant to foster a discussion about the meaning of matchRules R_ERASURE_MATCH and R_EQUIVALENT_MATCH when searching for generic methods.
I currently see three cases that need to be defined:
(1) Search for references to parameterized methods: Declaration: <T> void foo(T t); References: foo("Eclipse"), foo(new Integer(1))
(2) Search for references to method in parameterized type, where signature contains the type's type parameter: Declaration: interface List<E> ... { ... boolean add(E o); ... } References: - new ArrayList<String>.add("Eclipse") - new ArrayList.add("Eclipse") - new ArrayList.add(new Object()) - class StringList extends ArrayList<String> { public boolean add(String s) {..} } ... and client: new StringList.add("Eclipse");
(3) Search for references to method with generic parameter type: Declarations: foo(List l), foo(List<String> l) References: foo(new ArrayList<String>()), foo(new ArrayList()) ok with this three cases, but I would have named them: 1) Search for generic methods (ie. methods with type parameters) 2) Search for methods with type parameter arguments 3) Search for methods with parameterized type arguments
I don't know yet if additional cases 4)=1)+2) and 5)=1)+3) are specific or already treated by previous ones...

I've attached document which describes this behavior and have to figure out how to document it in eclipse...

Bug.Summery: Support for <task|type>defs.properties and AntLibs
Bug.WithStack:
In "Window > Preferences > Ant > Runtime" you can add new types and tasks to Ant. But when using task libraries (like Ant-Contrib) these libraries contain multiple tasks and types. But in a buildfile they can be imported easily using <taskdef resource="net/sf/antcontrib/antcontrib.properties" /> <if>... or <typedef resource="net/sf/antcontrib/antlib.xml"/> <if>... or <project xmlns:ac="antlib:net.sf.antcontrib"> <ac:if>...
It would be fine, if the Ant Runtime would support these kind of definitions. Maybe via an additional tab "Ant Libraries" where you can see a tree with the information: +-- antcontrib.properties (path-to-AntContrib.jar) | +-- if=ac...IfTask | +-- for=ac...ForTask +-- antlib.xml (path-to-AntContrib.jar) | +-- if=ac...IfTask | +-- for=ac...ForTask +-- ac:antlib:net.sf.antcontrib (path-to-AntContrib.jar) +-- ac:if=ac...IfTask +-- ac:for=ac...ForTask
When searching for existing bug reports I found: 71358 Poor performance editing Ant buildfile with "large" taskdef 78671 antRunner application no longer working with Ant-Contrib tasks
I think both are related to this but no duplicates because there are discussion only a small part of this and e.g. not the preference page. Good idea but not currently planned. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [1.5][model] Add IMethod#isVarArg()
Bug.WithStack:
I20041216
As described in bug 81151, flags AccTransient and AccVarargs overlap. Thus Flags.isVargs(method.getFlags()) returns true for a source method that has the transcient modifier set.
We should change the SourceElementParser to not use the modifier to store the varargs information, and add a isVarArgs(...) predicat on IMethod. Wondering if it should not rather consider AccVarargs as part of the flags, and discard transient from flags, to be consistent with binary side where flags are reflecting AccVarargs. Then I would rather propose we add: IMethod#wasTransient()
A method cannot have a transient modifier. This is illegal for a method. Only incorrect source model methods would ever answer true, if incorrectly tagged with bogus modifier. Important point is to match expectation with binaries. Should provide predicate for checking transient nature instead. Jerome - is this feasible for M6 ? If not, defer post 3.1 Sorry no time to do it. Defering post 3.1. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20041216

Wondering if it should not rather consider AccVarargs as part of the flags, and discard transient from flags, to be consistent with binary side where flags are reflecting AccVarargs. Then I would rather propose we add: IMethod#wasTransient()
A method cannot have a transient modifier. This is illegal for a method. Only incorrect source model methods would ever answer true, if incorrectly tagged with bogus modifier. Important point is to match expectation with binaries. Should provide predicate for checking transient nature instead. Jerome - is this feasible for M6 ? If not, defer post 3.1 Sorry no time to do it. Defering post 3.1. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: make applet & application programming a capability [general issues]
Bug.WithStack:
Using eclipse for all of my work, I notice that some features are rarely ever used, and get in the way of what I almost always want to do.
Creating applets is not what I do, and I suspect that the vaste majority of Eclipse users do not write applets.
Creating applications that run from a command-line using a main() method is also not what I do. I concede that this is a less general statement, but I suspect that this still is valid for a large amount of the eclipse users.
My feature request is that both of these types of applications are considered capabilities, just as is writing a plugin. I would expect the capability to create and run main()-type programs to be enabled, and the ability to write and run applets to be disabled by default.
It would be really great not to have to choose wheter or not I want to run my test-sources as applet or application :)
Cheers, Erik Not action planned for 3.1. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: junit test run on source folder have no obvious ordering [JUnit] [4]
Bug.WithStack:
When you run the unit-tests by right clicking a source-folder and selecting run -> Junit tests, all unit-tests are run. However, the order in which they are run, and appear in the junit-window does not have a logical ordering.
I would expect the ordering to be the same as the ordering of my source-folder.
Cheers, Erik JUnit doesn't make any assumption about the ordering. Actually for M4 we introduced a feature that runs failed test cases first in a rerun.
However, defining an ordering would still makes sense.
Time permitted. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

Bug.Summery: [browser] KeyListener is not notified
Bug.WithStack:
If you add a KeyListener to a Browser object, you will never get notified. I want to add a KeyListener, so i can disable the CTRL+N OLEacceletator, currently i have hacked the OleFrame class, so it calls my keyListener before checking for an OleAccelerator, but it would be nice if SWT provided the possibility to disable OleAccelerators though the KeyListener interface. The problem of not seeing key events is covered by 56223.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 56223 ***

Bug.Summery: XMLHeadTokenizerTester failed on Linux

Lines.Line: - testUTF16
- testUTF16BEWithJapaneseChars
- testUTF16LEWithJapaneseChars
- testUTF8With3ByteBOM
Finally looked into this old bug, and was a bug with test only, but an important
lesson to remember.

Bug.WithStack:
4 tests in XMLHeadTokenizerTester related to UTF16 and UTF8 3 byte BOM failed on Linux only. I found in the debugger that the first token XMLHeadTokenizer returned was EOF causing fEncoding not to be set in XMLHeadTokenizerTester.
The following tests have been commented out in XMLHeadTokenizerTester until we figured out why XMLHeadTokenizer is not working on Linux: - testUTF16 - testUTF16BEWithJapaneseChars - testUTF16LEWithJapaneseChars - testUTF8With3ByteBOM Finally looked into this old bug, and was a bug with test only, but an important lesson to remember.
Since JFlex is based on character parsing (only) when we want to detect something like byte patterns indicating 3 byte boms, etc., we use a special "byte reader" which forces each byte to be treated as a character. We were forgetting to do that for this specific test (maybe others?). Its still a bit of a mysterory to me why this was only detected on windows and not linux ... someday should investiage if related to the OS's native encoding/decoding assumptions, or, if related ot VM's treatment of non-caracters bytes?
In either case, the tests work correctly on both systems using the byte reader, so, will consider this bug squashed and add them back in. ... up to 1279 ... well within reange of 1300 to 1500. closing bug
Bug.WithOutStack:
4 tests in XMLHeadTokenizerTester related to UTF16 and UTF8 3 byte BOM failed on Linux only. I found in the debugger that the first token XMLHeadTokenizer returned was EOF causing fEncoding not to be set in XMLHeadTokenizerTester.
The following tests have been commented out in XMLHeadTokenizerTester until we figured out why XMLHeadTokenizer is not working on Linux: - testUTF16 - testUTF16BEWithJapaneseChars - testUTF16LEWithJapaneseChars - testUTF8With3ByteBOM Finally looked into this old bug, and was a bug with test only, but an important lesson to remember.
Since JFlex is based on character parsing (only) when we want to detect something like byte patterns indicating 3 byte boms, etc., we use a special "byte reader" which forces each byte to be treated as a character. We were forgetting to do that for this specific test (maybe others?). Its still a bit of a mysterory to me why this was only detected on windows and not linux ... someday should investiage if related to the OS's native encoding/decoding assumptions, or, if related ot VM's treatment of non-caracters bytes?
In either case, the tests work correctly on both systems using the byte reader, so, will consider this bug squashed and add them back in. ... up to 1279 ... well within reange of 1300 to 1500. closing bug

Bug.Summery: Default Server name renders error
Bug.WithStack:
I have experienced some problems adding and running a Tomcat 5.5 server. When using the default name creating the server "Tomcat v5.5 Server @ 127.0.0.1" I was propmted with a deployment error. When I removed the blanks from the name "Tomcatv5.5Server@127.0.0.1" it worked fine. What do you mean by "deployment error"? Can you give some more information so that we can tell where the error is coming from? When adding new Tomcat 5.5 server to Servers view it will create automatically configuration with name "Tomcat v5.5 Server @ localhost". If you'll try to start the server without publishing any projects, it will popup a info dialog saying "Publishing failed" and in Details "Could not publish server configuration: null."... If you'll open a configuration editor and make the it dirty and save, you'll be able to start without a problem.
I've tested with Tomcat 5.5, Eclipse M4, WTP SDK I20041218 The "Could not publish server configuration: null" was actually caused by a different issue unrelated to the server name, and this has been fixed for the second 12/20 build.
Kalle - Can you still reproduce this problem on the second 12/20 or later, and do you have any more information to help reproduce? No! I can no longer reprocude the error! I also noticed that it was not the server name that was the issu but rather that you had to make some change to the configuration and the save it. Ok, good. I've also fixed the default launch configuration name for each server to filter out any characters that are invalid for the OS. Closing.

Bug.Summery: [Navigator] Cannot open context menu on Navigator that is initially empty
Bug.WithStack:
200412152000
You can't pop up a context menu on an empty Navigator. After you create a project you can open the menu, even if you later delete that project (resulting in an empty navigator again). This is not reproducible on Windows. Is it reproducable in the package explorer? No, it's not. Strange. Could you try setting a breakpoint in ResourceNavigator.fillContextMenu and see if that's hit? We're just setting the menu on the Tree control. The contents of the menu depends on the selection, but not the popping up of it.
That method is not being hit... except...
If I click REALLY close to the left hand side of the view (within a few pixels) you will hit it. I strongly suspect this is a GTK Tree widget bug.
Fixed > 20041222
NOTE: This bug was introduced by the fix for bug 47065. The actual problem is that gtk_menu_popup() requires a real time stamp, not GDK_CURRENT_TIME. The original fix used the time field of the last event that was dispatched but not every event has a time field so that sometimes this was garbage. BB, please go and read the changes to Display.
VI & SN *** Bug 82124 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Bug.Summery: Body Text area of the Extensions page can't handle certain characters
Bug.WithStack:
200412152000
If the body text of an element contains XML escaped characters (ie: <) then the body text fails to display the entire text. For example, load the org.eclipse.ui.examples.javaeditor plugin. Look at the org.eclipse.ui.editors.templates->copy->pattern node text. All the field will display is < while the actual contents are:
<copy todir="${dst}"> <fileset dir="${src}"/> </copy> Janek, please take a look. Fixed

Bug.Summery: Cannot double click on folder to select/dismiss in DirectoryDialog
Bug.WithStack:
I200412160800
When I choose a destination folder for a zip file I am importing, I cannot double click on a folder to select it. Instead, I must select it and then click on OK. This is true on Windows also. Apologies for leaving this in the platform UI component for so long. not sure I understand the problem. For me, on windows and linux, when I double click in a folder in the DirectoryDialog it shows the content for that folder. To select the folder I have to select it and click on the Ok button.
This is right behaviour IMO. Closing as wontfix.

Bug.Summery: Pixel Corruption caused by Tracker on a Composite with children
[Preferences] Use web like search query for preferences
Bug.WithStack:
The current filter text search for the preferences tree is a great step forward from having nothing. It would be nice to enhance the filter by providing a better search, more like the query used by the help system or web search engines. For example, I don't have to type *path to get Build path. It should be enough to type "path" and see all the entries that have path in them. We intend to improve the regular expressions
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 80492 ***
